value.ai_summary: The SolidSample repository is an educational project designed to demonstrate and teach the SOLID principles of object-oriented design for C# developers, specifically targeting software engineers looking to improve their understanding of clean, maintainable code architecture. Created by Steve "ardalis" Smith as a companion to a Pluralsight course, the project provides a practical reference implementation that progressively refactors code to showcase each SOLID principle (Single Responsibility, Open-Closed, Liskov Substitution, Interface Segregation, and Dependency Inversion) through incremental code improvements. Developed using .NET and Visual Studio 2019, the repository offers multiple tagged branches representing different stages of implementation, allowing developers to track the evolution of code as SOLID principles are applied. The project is particularly valuable for intermediate C# developers seeking to understand how to create more flexible, scalable, and modular software designs by breaking down complex systems into loosely coupled, highly cohesive components. While serving primarily as an educational resource, the repository also functions as a living reference for best practices in software design, with clear documentation and links to additional learning resources. The repository is especially recommended for developers interested in improving code quality, maintainability, and adherence to established software design principles.
